statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: BOSTON (AP) -Tim Clifford scored 22 points and Keith Simmons added 20 Tuesday night to help Holy Cross record a 82-69 win over Harvard.
article.headline: BOSTON (AP) -Tim Clifford scored 22 points and Keith Simmons added 20 Tuesday night to help Holy Cross record a 82-69 win over Harvard.
article.linkText: BOSTON (AP) -Tim Clifford scored 22 points and Keith Simmons added 20 Tuesday night to help Holy Cross record a 82-69 win over Harvard.
article.story: Jim Goffredo scored 22 points. Drew Housman scored 13 with four assists. Holy Cross (4-0) has not opened their season on such a streak since 1988-89 when they went 6-0. Harvard (1-3) made 18 of 26 shots from the free throw line but were outrebounded 33-29. The Crusaders also made 10 of 18 3-pointers. Torey Thomas scored 12 points for Holy Cross including 4 of 6 from the field. Brian Cusworth had 10 points for Harvard and led both teams with 11 rebounds. The Crusaders broke open a tightly contested game with a 14-0 run over the game's final four minutes. They took their biggest lead of the night, 79-64, on two free throws by Alex Vander Baan with 39 seconds remaining. Harvard trailed by as many as 14 points, 29-15 with 6:04 on the clock before coming back and closing the gap to 35-29 at halftime. Clifford led both teams in scoring with 16 points. The Crimson opened the second half with a 11-2 run to take a 40-37 lead, their first since the initial basket of the game, on a 3-pointer by Goffredo. Holy Cross went on a 8-2 run with 6:40 left in the game behind a pair of shots behind the arc by Simmons and Torey Thomas, to open a 63-59 lead. But Harvard tied the game on a Housman jump shot a minute later. The Crusaders answered with back-to-back 3-pointers by Pat Doherty and Vander Baan to take a 71-63 lead with 2:30 remaining.
